jobDescription:
Who We Are:

Founded in 2009, Reformation is a revolutionary lifestyle brand that proves fashion and sustainability can coexist. We combine stylish, vintage-inspired designs with sustainable practices, releasing limited-edition collections for individuals who want to look beautiful and live sustainably. Setting an example for the industry, Reformation remains at the forefront of innovation in sustainable fashion—running the first sustainable factory in Los Angeles, using deadstock and eco fabrics, tracking and sharing the environmental impact of every product, and investing in the people who make this revolution possible. The brand has also established itself as a pioneer in retail innovation, developing an in-store tech concept that brings the best of its online experience to its physical doors.

We are a future focused organization committed to the belief that the problems facing our planet and society can be solved through innovation, common sense and education. Being naked is the #1 most sustainable option. We're #2.

Here at Ref, we put people first. We know that you can't innovate and do cool stuff without having everyone on board. So we work to create a culture where everyone feels like they belong and where their voices are truly valued. We build an inclusive culture together and make a real impact along the way.

Project Manager Facilities:

Will be responsible for overseeing the operation, maintenance, and improvement of all Reformation facilities, including retail stores, corporate oﬃces, and production facilities. This role will play a critical part in ensuring that our physical spaces are eﬃcient, safe, and aligned with our sustainability goals. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in facilities management, with 5+ years of experience in a leadership role.

What You’ll Do:

Strategic Facilities Management: Oversee and continually enhance the facilities maintenance program, including preventive services, custodial work, and machinery upkeep. Implement cutting-edge solutions to ensure that security systems and other critical infrastructure are robust and future-proof.

Optimize Facilities Management Systems: Strategically manage the third-party facilities management system (Service Channel), ensuring that all retail store work requests are resolved eﬃciently, within budget, and at the highest quality standards. Leverage data and insights to drive continuous improvement.

Project Leadership: Take ownership of major facilities projects, from vendor selection and coordination to the successful completion of corporate build-outs and facilities improvements. Ensure that all projects align with Reformation's strategic priorities and are delivered on time and within budget.

Operational Eﬃciency and Sustainability: Assess and reﬁne operational procedures to maximize space and equipment utilization, minimize waste, and enhance overall eﬃciency. Partner with the procurement team to evaluate and manage business services, ensuring that sustainability, quality, and cost are balanced.

Team Leadership and Development: Lead, mentor, and empower the Facilities Coordinators and Front Desk team to excel in their roles. Foster a culture of safety, health, and productivity while aligning team goals with broader organizational objectives.

Policy and Safety Management: Develop and maintain comprehensive safety, security, and business continuity plans. Ensure that all relevant policies and procedures are up-to-date, well-communicated, and strategically aligned with the organization's goals.

Financial Oversight and Reporting: Prepare detailed departmental reports and budget reconciliations, actively seeking opportunities for cost optimization. Collaborate with the Director of Retail Operations and Finance team to drive ﬁnancial eﬃciency in both corporate and retail operations.

Support Strategic Growth: Provide critical support for new store openings, facilitating smooth transitions from Retail Development to Retail Operations. Ensure that each new location is fully integrated into the operational ecosystem and aligned with Reformation's strategic vision.

Event and Communications Strategy: Provide strategic support for oﬃce events, ensuring they align with Reformation's culture and business objectives. Lead internal communications regarding operational changes and events, ensuring all stakeholders are informed and engaged.

Drive Operational Excellence: Lead the daily operations of Reformation's facilities, ensuring that workspaces are optimized for eﬃciency, sustainability, and team productivity. Develop strategies to maintain an organized, clean, and fully equipped environment that supports business growth and agility.
